Subject: Predefined Content ID/BR wrongfully being detected
Description:
We have been experiencing lots of false-positives identifying numbers sequences as ID/BR, impacting our production policies. Sometimes, even small number sequences are identified as ID/BR.

We need to understand how this predefined content works, because in Brazil CPF is a very unique number format for example: 123.456.789-10. Sometimes it will be punctuated, sometimes not. CPF also have a mathematical formula used to calculate the number correctly, which can be used to find the correct verifying digit.

We also have cases with custom content regarding emails with our domain being blocked, even though we have an allow list with our domain.
Solution_Comment__c:
Enabling the Ignore Trust option resolved the HSTS warnings.

The "Ignore Trust" functionality no longer validates the certificate trust against the Root certificate. As the DPI functionality is constantly evolving at a global level, it helps reduce the negative impacts.
